compounddef.innerclass: async_data_op_req< const std::basic_string< C, T, A > >

briefdescription.para: Validate inputs at the point of instantiation.

detaileddescription.para: Turns on the checking of inputs for validity and throwing of exception conditions at the point of instantiation rather than waiting until those inputs are sent for dispatch. This, being very useful for debugging, defaults to 1 except when `NDEBUG` is defined i.e. final release builds.

briefdescription.para: Determines if AFIO is compiled as headers only. Defaults to 1.
Determines if AFIO is bound against Boost.Thread or the C++ 11 STL thread. Defaults to 0.
Determines if AFIO is bound against Boost.Filesystem or the C++ 1z Filesystem TS. Defaults to 1 unless on VS2015 which provides a full Filesystem TS implementation.
Determines if AFIO is bound against standalone ASIO or Boost.ASIO. Defaults to undefined, and therefore Boost.ASIO.

memberdef.name: BOOST_AFIO_DECLARE_CLASS_ENUM_AS_BITFIELD
memberdef.initializer: inline BOOST_CONSTEXPR type operator&(type a, type b) \ { \ return static_cast<type>(static_cast<size_t>(a) & static_cast<size_t>(b)); \ } \ inline BOOST_CONSTEXPR type operator|(type a, type b) \ { \ return static_cast<type>(static_cast<size_t>(a) | static_cast<size_t>(b)); \ } \ inline BOOST_CONSTEXPR type operator~(type a) \ { \ return static_cast<type>(~static_cast<size_t>(a)); \ } \ inline BOOST_CONSTEXPR bool operator!(type a) \ { \ return 0==static_cast<size_t>(a); \ }

briefdescription.para: No flags set.
Read access.
Write access.
Read and write access.
Append only.
Truncate existing file to zero.
Open and create if doesn't exist.
Create and open only if doesn't exist.
Will be exclusively either read or written sequentially. If you're exclusively writing sequentially, strongly consider turning on OSDirect too.
Will be randomly accessed, so don't bother with read-ahead. If you're using this, strongly consider turning on OSDirect too.
Hold a file handle open to the containing directory of each open file for fast directory enumeration.
Return a unique directory handle rather than a shared directory handle.
Bypass the OS file buffers (only really useful for writing large files, or a lot of random reads and writes. Note you must 4Kb align everything if this is on)
Memory map files (for reads only).
Ask the OS to not complete until the data is on the physical storage. Best used only with OSDirect, otherwise use SyncOnClose.
Automatically initiate an asynchronous flush just before file close, and fuse both operations so both must complete for close to complete.

Ensure that data writes to files reach physical storage in the same order as the op dependencies close files. Does NOT enforce ordering of individual data writes, ONLY all file writes accumulated before a file close.
Internal use only. Don't use.
Internal use only. Don't use.
Bitwise file and directory open flags.
No flags set.
Call chained completion immediately instead of scheduling for later. Make SURE your completion can not block!
Bitwise async_op_flags flags.
No flags set.
Return the maximum possible metadata.
Bitflags for availability of metadata from `struct stat_t`.
Returns the process threadpool.

detaileddescription.para: On first use, this instantiates a default std_thread_pool running `BOOST_AFIO_MAX_NON_ASYNC_QUEUE_DEPTH` threads which will remain until its shared count reaches zero.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::shared_ptr< thread_source > threadpool=process_threadpool(), file_flags flagsforce=file_flags::None, file_flags flagsmask=file_flags::None)
memberdef.name: make_async_file_io_dispatcher

briefdescription.para: Instatiates the best available async_file_io_dispatcher implementation for this system.

detaileddescription.para: Note that the number of threads in the threadpool supplied is the maximum non-async op queue depth (e.g. file opens, closes etc.). For fast SSDs, there isn't much gain after eight-sixteen threads, so the process threadpool is set to eight by default. For slow hard drives, or worse, SANs, a queue depth of 64 or higher might deliver significant benefits.

simplesect.para: A shared_ptr to the best available async_file_io_dispatcher implementation for this system.

parameterdescription.para: The threadpool instance to use for asynchronous dispatch.
The flags to bitwise OR with any opened file flags. Used to force on certain flags.
The flags to bitwise AND with any opened file flags. Used to force off certain flags.

briefdescription.para: Returns a result when any the supplied ops complete. Does not propagate exception states.

simplesect.para: A future vector of shared_ptr's to async_io_handle.

parameterdescription.para: An iterator type.
An instance of std::nothrow_t.
An iterator pointing to the first async_io_op to wait upon.
An iterator pointing after the last async_io_op to wait upon.

memberdef.name: make_async_data_op_req

briefdescription.para: Convenience instantiator of a async_data_op_req, letting the compiler deduce the template specialisation to use.

simplesect.para: An async_data_op_req matching the supplied parameter type. Constructs an instance.

parameterdescription.para: An optional precondition for this operation
A pointer to memory or reference to object into which to read or write
The offset at which to transfer

briefdescription.para: Provides a batch asynchronous file i/o implementation based on Boost.ASIO.
